title: Imac 21.5 A1418 (EMC 2544) - No soud After install parallels
message:

Does the audio work when booting a OS X installation from a external drive?

message:
So you fucked with the BIOS and now the machine is dead.....What file did you use? Which programmer did you use? Is the "quad enable" bit set when programming the chip? 
You should NEVER have touched the BIOS, makes no sense at all. Upload original dump here for verification.

title: Imac 21.5 A1418 (EMC 2544) - No soud After install parallels
message:
Alright so something freaky is going on with the Audio Codec U6101. Its probably not something much further down the line because both channels are not working.

What are the voltages of the following traces (Probe close to the chip):
- PP3V3_S0_AUDIO
- PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG
- PP5V_S0_AUDIO

title: Imac 21.5 A1418 (EMC 2544) - No soud After install parallels
message: It is just a software issue with parallels. Just uninstall it. If it works in OSX there is nothing wrong with the hardware.

title: Imac 21.5 A1418 (EMC 2544) - No soud After install parallels
message: I do not support Windows on Apple devices, but it will probably work. Will need external speakers of course.

title: Imac 21.5 A1418 (EMC 2544) - No soud After install parallels
message:
If you feel like repairing the board instead of getting a USB audio card you can replace the chip (U6101)

If you want to be sure that the chip is actually malfunctioning you can check the signal of HDA_SDOUT with a oscilloscope (It should differ when playing audio vs. playing nothing). If there is no signal at all the codec is not receiving any audio information and thus not malfunctioning.
You might also check PP1V5_S0_AUD_DIG and the 3 other power lines you checked earlier right at the chips pins to exclude the chance of it being a broken trace (very unlikely)

But again like duke said you can also just get a USB audio device as output, but not sure if the customer would be happy with that. Its up to you/them
